body.p: Gradle's Configuration Cache is a feature that significantly improves build performance by caching the result of the configuration phase and reusing it in subsequent builds.
Starting with version 2.8.0, the DITA-OT Gradle plugin fully supports Configuration Cache when using the default DITA_SCRIPT execution strategy.

section.title: What is Configuration Cache?
section.p: The Configuration Cache stores the task graph after the configuration phase completes. On subsequent builds with the same configuration, Gradle can skip the configuration phase entirely and load the cached task graph directly.

ul.li: Gradle 8.1 or later (Configuration Cache is stable)
DITA-OT 3.0 or later (required for DITA_SCRIPT strategy)
